intro: Cybianthus cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Cybianthus cuneifolius is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
